Thus, he is requesting this third loan to buy two 10-tonne truckloads of rafters and boards, plus a load of plywood. He purchases his lumber from surrounding towns (Tinkrela, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) and then saws them before taking them to Sikasso to be made into furniture, benches, picnic tables, desks, and chairs for resale. 

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 330,000 francs CFA that will be used for helping with family expenses and paying the loan interest. The rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy some lumber

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan a 45 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 2 enfants  à Bougoula ville, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Assitan après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité de restauration depuis plus de quinze ans. Elle mène son activité devant la cour de l’école catholique tous les jours où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses repas. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de quatre ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Avec ce premier prêt individuel, elle compte acheter, 2 sacs de pomme de terre, 10 kilos de viande de bœuf, 20 kilos de poissons frais, 5 litres d’huile alimentaire, 2 paquets de magie, 2 bidons de vinaigre, 20 sachets d’Attièkè, 2 sacs de charbon de bois, 20 miches de pain et  des régimes bananes (Aloko). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place.
Les plats sont vendues au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée très généralement  d’élèves, des jeunes (célibataires) surtout de main d'ouvrier travaillant à l’usine. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Assitan is 45 years old and lives in with her husband and two children in Bougoula City, the downtown of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses without success, Ms. Assitan became familiar with the restaurant business over fifteen years ago. She operates her business each day in front of the courtyard of the Catholic school, where she is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her meals. 

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso over four years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association in her district, she is now on her first individual loan. 

With this first individual loan, she intends to buy: 2 sacks of potatoes, 10 kg of beef, 20 kg of fresh fish, 5 liters of cooking oil, 2 packets of Magie [bouillon cubes], 2 containers of vinegar, 20 pouches of attièkè [cassava couscous], 2 sacks of charcoal, 20 loaves of bread, and some bananas (aloko). She purchases her goods locally.

For cash or on credit, her dishes are sold to a customer base composed generally of students, young folks (unmarried), and especially laborers working at the factory. 

She envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, help with family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Kenga

texts.fr:
Âgé de 45 ans, Monsieur Kenga est marié et vit avec son épouse et  ses 3 enfants  dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Kenga après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès telle  la location de véhicules, il finit par opter s’initier au commerce notamment l’achat et la vente des articles divers pour Alimentation (Eau minérale, boissons, biscuits, etc.). Il dispose d’une alimentation située à l’auto gare de Sikasso. Nanti d’une dizaine année expérience, il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier prêt
 Ce premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 25 cartons de l’Eau minérale, 25 paquets de boissons NBB, 15 cartons de biscuits et 10 cartons de Déodorant.. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes sur place avant de les revendre en gros, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales de la ville.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Mr. Kenga is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in a large traditional extended family in the city of Sikasso.  After operating a few businesses without success, such as rental cars, he ended up opting to start a business in the purchase and sale of groceries (mineral water, drinks, cookies, etc.). He operates a store located at the bus station in Sikasso.  Mr. Kenga has about 10 years of experience and is sought after by many customers  for the quality of his products.  To meet growing customer demand, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization and is asking for his first loan.  This first loan will enable him to buy 25 cartons of mineral water, 25 packs of NBB drink, 15 boxes of cookies, and 10 boxes of deodorant. His merchandise is purchased from on-site wholesalers before being resold wholesale and retail, for cash and for credit, to customers from every social class in the city.  With this loan, he expects to earn an average monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA that will be used to contribute towards family expenses and to pay the interest on his loan, with the remaining amount invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy various food items.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est âgée de  plus de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Fatoumata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité de vente des calebasses il y a environ 3 ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque années. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association AMIDEF de Banconi), elle est présentement à son deuxième prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Ainsi, elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour acheter, 5 colis de calebasses afin de les revendre  en détail à ses clientes majoritairement composée de orpailleurs.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata is over 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She resides with her husband and their children in Sikasso City. After having run many businesses without success, Ms. Fatoumata introduced herself to this business of selling calabash bowls about three years ago. 

Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, Ms. Fatoumata decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a few years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association in her district (Association AMIDEF de Banconi), she is now on her second individual loan. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

Thus, she is requesting this second loan to buy 5 packs of calabashes in order to sell them retail to her customers, who are for the most part composed of people who pan for gold. 

With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata envisions making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to help with family expenses and to pay the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy calabash bowls

loans.name: Safoura

texts.fr:
Née  vers 1968 à Sikasso, Madame Safoura est une femme mariée, mère de trois  enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Banconi, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso.    
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est vite initiée il a environ quatorze années aux activités de petit commerce  telles l’achat-vente des calebasses  et des biscuits. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.
   Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec  qui elle a déjà  bénéficié de plusieurs prêt solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association AMIDEF de Banconi). elle est à présent à son deuxième prêt individuel et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Elle sollicite  ce deuxième prêt individuel pour acheter, 5 colis de calebasses  et 5 cartons de biscuits.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Elle dispose d’une place au niveau de marché de leur quartier où elle vend ses marchandises au comptant, en détail et à crédit avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 140 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari à subvenir aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born around 1968 in Sikasso, Ms. Safoura is married and mother of three children.  She lives with her husband and their children in Banconi, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso.  Unable to attend school for social reasons, she quickly started 14 years ago, a small business buying and selling gourds and cookies. She is very sought after by her customers (mainly consisting of women) for the quality of her products.  In order to better satisfy the ever-growing demand of her clientele, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization. She has already received several group loans via an association of women from her neighborhood (AMIDEF Association of Banconi).  She is currently on her second individual loan. Her first one was fully repaid.  She is asking for her second loan to buy 5 packages of gourds and 5 boxes of cookies.  She has a place at the neighborhood market where she sells her goods for cash, retail, and for credit.  She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 140,000 FCFA that will be used to help her husband take care of family expenses and to pay for the interest on her loan.  The remaining amount will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various articles.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de six femmes mariées et d’une veuve, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Kakiya, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de savon, de céréales et d’articles divers de boutique..                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire 
La cliente SADIO, au milieu sur la photo, compte acheter 10 paniers de tomate, 50 kilos d’oignons, 2 cartons de poisson fumé pour ensuite les vendre sur place à domicile et en ambulante dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en: The Benkadi group consists of six married women and one widow. Their average age is 35. They have an average of 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Kakiya, in the prefecture of Baroueli, in the region of Segou. They met through kinship, neighborhood connections, and friends.  They are in the business of selling condiments, soap, grains, and various store items.  The women of the Benkadi group are on their 14th group loan.  Sadio, in the middle of the photo, plans to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes, 50 kg of onions, and 2 boxes of smoked fish for resale from her home and by walking around the village to female and male customers.  She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA that will be used for the needs of her family. A portion will be reinvested in the condiments business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 26-year-old man. He is married and a father of two children who live together with him in Sana`a, Yemen. 

For the past three years, he has had a "tahoun" (mill) for grinding grain. It has been a profitable project and is the only source of income for the family. His business is a service before being commercial.

Fares is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy grain to diversify his range. This will enable him to improve the quality of his work and increase the family's income to help them live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy grain to diversify his range

loans.name: Ester Diane

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Ester Diane est mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Elle fait le commerce de la quincaillerie et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marché de l'extérieur. Ses clients sont constitués par des manœuvres et des ouvriers. En vue d'agrandir son commerce, Ester Diane a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le revenu supplémentaire l'aidera à participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ester Diane, age 29, is a married mother of two children who go to school. She sells hardware items and buys her merchandise on the foreign market. 
Her customer base consists of manual labourers and workmen. 

Ester Diane is seeking a loan from Finadev to expand her business. The extra income she expects to earn will help her to provide for the family’s

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen nails, 2 dozen keys, and 2 dozen handles.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Né vers 1977 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Yacouba est marié et père de six  enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à Bougoula Hameau environ 7km de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Yacouba après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié aux activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers Il dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers : maïs, Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, savon, etc depuis plus de douze années. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya environ quatre  ans. Ainsi il bénéficia  de cinq prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. Alors, il sollicite ce sixième prêt lui permettant d’acquérir, 10 tonnes de maïs, 20 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 cartons du thé, 5 sacs du sucre, 10 paquets de lait en poudre, 8 paquets de bonbon, 15 paquet de Chewing Gum, 35 paquets d’allumette et 10 cartons de savon.
 S’approvisionnant auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et environnants, il revend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes sortes de couches sociales de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born around 1977, Mr. Yacouba is married and father of six children. He lives with his wife and their children in a traditional family in Bougoula Hameau, about 7 km from the city of Sikasso. Mr. Yacouba, after operating a few businesses unsuccessfully, started a business buying and selling various articles. For over 12 years, he has had a store in front of his home where he buys and sells: corn, cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc.  He is much sought after by his customers for the quality of his products.  To satisfy growing customer demand, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization about four years ago.  He has received five individual loans, all of which have been fully repaid. He is now asking for a sixth loan that will enable him to buy 10 tons of corn, 20 cartons of different cigarettes, 5 boxes of tea, 5 bags of sugar, 10 packets of powdered milk, 8 packages of candy, 15 packs of chewing gum, 35 packs of matches, and 10 boxes of soap. Sourcing from wholesalers in and nearby the city of Sikasso, he resells his goods retail, for cash and for credit, to customers from all social classes in his area.  With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA that will be used to contribute to family expenses and to pay the interest on his loan. The remaining amount will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy grain and various articles.

loans.name: Sonagnon  Jeannette

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Sonagnon Jeannette est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle vend des yaourts, glaces, boissons dans une cafétariat. Sonagnon Jeannette dispose d'une clientèle constituée par les habitants de sa zone. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité un micro crédit à Finadev.
texts.en:
Sonagnon Jeannette, age 48, is a married mother of five children. She sells yogurts, ice cream and beverages in a cafeteria. Her customer base is composed of local residents. 

She is seeking a loan from Finadev to strengthen her working capital and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of beverages and 7 cases of canned drinks.

loans.name: Mah

texts.fr:
Née vers 1963 à Sikasso, Madame Mah est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle vit chez son époux avec ses enfants dans le quartier Wayerema II de la ville de Sikasso.
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de  vingt ans à cette activité génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans son lieu d’achat et vente des condiments au marché de Wayerema II dont elle dispose un kiosque.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cessait d’accroitre, elle décida  de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ 5 ans. Après 4 prêts individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel  qui lui permettra d’acheter, 10 seaux de pâtes d’arachide, 5 cartons magie, 5 cartons concentrée de tomate,  10 sacs d’oignons et 5 cartons de moutarde à Sikasso. Madame Mah vend  au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born around 1963 in Sikasso, Ms. Mah is married and mother of four children. She lives with her husband and her children in the Wayerema II neighborhood of the city of Sikasso.  After operating a few businesses unsuccessfully, she has been in the income-generating business of buying and selling condiments for over 20 years.  She enjoys a great reputation at the Wayerema II market where she has a kiosk.  In order to better satisfy the demand of an ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization about five years ago.  After four individual loans that were all fully repaid, she is on her fifth individual loan that will enable her to buy 10 buckets of peanut paste, 5 boxes of Maggi, 5 boxes of tomato paste, 10 bags of onions, and 5 boxes of mustard in Sikasso.  Ms. Mah sells for cash, retail, and for credit to male and female customers.  With this loan, she expects to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA that will be used to pay her essential expenses, to contribute to family expenses, and to pay for the interest on her loan. The remaining amount will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Charafatou's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 54 ans, Charafatou est veuve et n'a aucun enfant à charge. Charafatou a une boutique à domicile où elle commercialise des plastiques, canaris et chaussures. Charafatou s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de répondre à  ses besoins personnels, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Charafatou, aged 54, is a widow and has no children to support. She has a store in her home where she sells plasticware, earthenware, and shoes. She gets her supplies from markets in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business capital and supporting herself, Charafatou requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. The official is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen plastic items, 2 dozen earthen jars, and 3 dozen fly swatters

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es:
El grupo XII lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Zoila Luz quien desde hace 12 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo la cual se vende generalmente los fines de semana. Ella comercializa su producto en uno de los mercados más grande de Managua e invertira el credito en insumos en especial maiz, leña, cerdo...etc.

Las otras integrantes son Melenciana quien tiene una tortillería, Zenobia quien tiene una pulpería y vende enchiladas desde hace 6 años y Ignacio de Jesús quien vende hojas desde hace 22 años.
texts.en:
The Grupo Pio XII (Pius XII Group) is composed of four hardworking people. One of them is Zoila Luz who has been working for 12 years preparing and selling “nactamales”, a typical Nicaraguan dish made of maize and pork that she generally sells during the week-ends. She sells her products in one of the biggest markets of Managua, and she will use her loan purchase corn, firewood, pork etc.

The other members of the group are Melencia, who runs a “tortilleria” (tortillas bakery); Zenobia, who runs a general store and who has been selling enchiladas for 6 years, and Ignazio de Jesús, who has been selling bay leaves for 22 years.

loans.use: To buy pork, corn, firewood, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Duo En Las Manos De Dios Group

texts.es: Duo en las manos de Dios. la señora Evangelina tiene 52 años de edad, ella se a dedicado a la purificacion de agua desde hace 5 años, ella logro comprar los equipos necesarios para la purificacion de agua, ella esta colicitando este credito para la compra de equipo para la purificacion de agua ya que nececita mas capital para invertir.ella espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que ella nececita.
texts.en:
Duo en las Manos de Dios

Evangelina is 52 years old.  She has made a living in water purification for the past 5 years.  She managed to buy the necessary equipment for water purification.  She is requesting this loan to buy equipment for the purification of water, since she needs more money to invest.  She hopes that she can be given the support that she needs.

loans.use: to buy equipment for water purification.

loans.name: Senouvi Yollande

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans, Senouvi Yollande vit avec son mari et a un enfant. Elle vend des mèches, produits, divers et liqueurs dans sa boutique depuis 07 ans. Sa clientèle est constituée de femmes et des hommes. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le gain dégagé lui permettra d'améliorer ses conditions de vie économique et sociale.
texts.en: Senouvi Yollande, aged 27, lives with her husband and child. For seven years, she has been selling hair extensions, products, and various other goods, and liquor, in her store. Her customer base is composed of men and women. With the goal of increasing her capital, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. The profit earned will enable her to improve her living situation, economically and socially.

loans.use: to buy a batch of toilet paper, 5 trays of eggs, a 10-liter container of red oil, a box of sugar, and a box of liquor

loans.name: Eugenie Omoladoun

texts.fr: Agée de 40 ans, Eugenie Omoladoun vit avec son mari et son enfant. Coiffeuse de formation, elle y associe la vente des mèches, produits et divers depuis 13 ans. Sa clientèle est constituée de femmes de tout âge. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de commerce, Eugenie Omoladoun a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le gain dégagé lui permettra de réaliser ses ambitions et de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant.
texts.en:
Eugenie Omoladoun, age 40, lives with her husband and their child. A hairdresser by trade, she started selling hair extensions, cosmetics and other products as a sideline 13 years ago. Her customers are women of every age. 

Eugenie Omoladoun is seeking a loan from Finadev to strengthen her working capital. The benefits earned through this credit will help her to achieve her goals and provide for her child.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen hair extensions, 2 cartons of soap, one box of sugar and one box of hair straightener.

loans.name: Vida Abundante Group

texts.es:
El grupo Vida Abundante lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Margarita del Carmen quien vende productos varios desde hace varios años principalmente refrescos, jugos, gaseosas y comida los fines de semana. El credito lo invertirá en la compra de refrescos, gaseosa y granos basicos, perecederos.

Las otras integrantes son Victoria quien vende ropa desde hace 40 años y Maria  quien vende ropa desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
Vida Abundante (Aboundant Life Group) is a group composed of three hardworking people. One of them is Margarita del Carmen, who has been selling different products for many years, particularly soft drinks, juices, fizzy drinks and food during the week-ends.  She plans to use her loan to purchase perishable goods, such as soda and basic grains.  

The other members are Victoria, who has been selling clothes for 40 years, and Maria, who has been selling clothes for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Misericordia Del Señor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Misericordia del señor lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Gloria Elena quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace varios años. El crédito lo invertirá en pantalones, blusas, ropa íntima, camisetas…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Ruth quien vende nacatamales y cuajadas desde hace 5 años y Carla Patricia quien vende ropa desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Grupo Misericordia del Señor (Mercy of the Lord Group) is composed of three hardworking and resourceful women. One of them is Gloria Elena, who has been selling clothes for various years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, blouses, underwear and T-shirts.
The other members of the group are Ruth, who has been selling “nactamales” and “cuajadas” (typical Nicaraguan dishes) for 5 years, and Carla Patricia, who has been selling clothes for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy trousers, blouses, underwear and T-shirts.

loans.name: Santana Sur Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santana Sur lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha Teresa quien desde hace 10 años tiene una mueblería negocio que tiene junto a su esposo don Oscar. El crédito lo invertirá en bambú y madera para realizar sillas, sillones, roperos…etc. 
Las otras integrantes son Francisca quien vende granos básicos y yuca desde hace 15 años y Juana María  tiene un taller de relación y mantenimiento de refrigeración donde trabaja con su esposo quien es técnico.
texts.en:
The Santana Sur group is composed of three hardworking and resourceful people. One of them is Martha Teresa who has been running a furniture workshop for 10 years together with her husband Oscar. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bamboo and wood to make chairs, armchairs and wardrobes.
The other members of the group are Francisca, who has been selling basic grains for 15 years and Juana María, who runs a repair shop providing maintenance to air-conditioning and cooling systems together with her husband, who is a technician.

loans.use: To buy bamboo and wood.

loans.name: Las M Group

texts.es:
El grupo lo conforman cuatro mujeres emprendedoras ellas son María del Socorro, Jessenia del Carmen, Esmilda del Carmen y Miriam las cuales se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años  e invertirán el crédito en la compra de perecederos de temporada principalmente aguacate, mangos, jocotes, tamarindo…etc. 
La coordinadora es la señora Maria del Socorro quien desde hace 1995 comercializa perecederos en uno de los mercados más grande de Managua. Ella invertirá el crédito en aguacate y jocotes futa de temporada.
texts.en:
The group consists of four entrepreneurial women. They are María del Socorro, Jessenia del Carmen, Esmilda del Carmen and Miriam. For several years, they make a living selling fruits and vegetables and will use the loan to purchase seasonal perishable goods mainly avocado, mango, jocotes, tamarind...etc

The coordinator is the Maria del Socorro who has been selling perishable goods since 1995 in one of the largest markets of Managua. She will use the loan to purchase avocados and jocotes, fruits of the season.

loans.use: to purchase avocados and jocotes, fruits of the season.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Victoria est la responsable d'un groupe de deux personnes. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Victoria a une boutique où elle commercialise des mèches et produits depuis 03 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place et de l'extérieur. Sa clientèle est essentiellement constituée de femmes de tout âge. Victoria veut s'offrir deux balles de mèches et compte prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants. Elle a alors sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Victoria, aged 34, is the official of a two-person group. She is married and the mother of four children, all in school. She has a store where she has sold hair extensions and other products for three years. She gets her supplies from a local market and from abroad. Her customer base is essentially composed of women of all ages. 

Victoria wants to sell two bales of hair extensions and plans on paying for the care of her children. So she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. The official is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen weaves, 10 dozen hair extensions, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 4 bags of gari flour.

loans.name: Sarepta Plus Group

texts.en:
Isabelle, aged 47, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Sarepta Plus”, which is composed of 18 members, united in solidarity to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Isabelle started her business in 2006 doing the same activity. She operates a drugstore in the eastern part of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received seven different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to buy more medicine needed by her customers in her area to resell with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of about $50. 

Her ambition is to expand her business by opening other drugstores in different places. Isabelle is married and has two children, aged 13 and 19 years old. Both go to school.

loans.use: to purchase medicine needed by her customers

loans.name: Joie Plus Group

texts.en:
JP, age 46, is the chairman of the community bank named "Joie Plus", which consists of 15 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution, HOPE DRC, with the goal of developing their businesses. 

JP has been in the microenterprise world since 2001. He has been selling drinks. His drink facility is located west of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of HOPE DRC, who has already received nine different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to diversify his business by buying some juice drinks with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $60. His ambition is to open a larger drink facility in his area. JP is married and the father of four children aged between 4 and 15 years old. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to diversify his business by buying dozens of juice drinks with the aim of increasing his profits.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.es: Elsa tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y con 3 hijos. Ella pertenece al grupo comunal "Jehova Jireh" conformado por 7 integrantes desde hace 6 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortas y pasteles; productos que vende desde muy temprano todos los días. Además, de manera complementaria ella vende productos de belleza. El préstamo lo usará para comprar adornos para las tortas, esto hará que sus productos sean más atractivos a la vista de sus clientes y le generará mayores ingresos económicos, de esa manera le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Elsa es una mujer trabajadora, enfocada y diligente así como todas las socias de este grupo.
texts.en: Elsa is 51 years old, married with three children. She belongs to the "Jehova Jireh" communal bank, made up of 7 members for over six years. She sells cakes and pastries very early in the morning. She also sells beauty products. She will use the loan to purchase decorations for her cakes to make them appear more attractive to her clients and in this way generate more income. This will give her and her family a better quality of life. She is a hard working woman, focused, and diligent just like the rest of the members of this group.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Zaninab

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Zaninab. She is married and has three children, 32, 20 and 16. 

In 1997, Zaninab established her sand business. She began her business because she did not go to school. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business as profit. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Zaninab requires the loan in order to buy more sand. In the future, Zainab plans to to build a house and to give her children a quality education. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more sand.

loans.name: Idiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Idiatu from Goderich in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone.  She is married and has three children between the ages of five years and 19 years.  Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2004, Idiatu established her business, selling general merchandise.  She began her business because she needed to generate enough income to assist her husband.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Idiatu requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, vegetable oil, eggs, mayonnaise and cigarettes.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living.  In the future, Idiatu plans to establish her business in another location and employ staff members.  

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, vegetable oil, eggs, mayonnaise and cigarettes.

loans.name: Tounsidazanga 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme AISSATA est la représentante du groupe TOUNSIDAZANGA II. Elle est mariée et mère de sept(07) enfants. Le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 14 ans. Parmi ses enfants trois (03) vont à l’école. Elle a neuf (09) personnes en charge.

	Mme est restauratrice depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de gounghin et pissy. Ses clients sont ses amis et voisins.

	Mme veut s’acheter 01 sac de haricot, ½ sac de riz, 01 bidon d’huile et 01 plat de sel. 

Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour épargner et aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir d’autres restaurants.
texts.en:
Ms. AISSATA is the representative of the group TOUNSIDAZANGA II. She is married and the mother of seven children. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 14. Three of the children go to school. She has nine persons to support. 

Ms. AISSATA has been a restauranteur for ten years. She gets her supplies from the market of Gounghin & Pissy. Her customers are her friends and neighbors.

She wants to buy a sack of beans, a half-sack of rice, a container of oil, and a plateful of salt. 

She puts her profits toward her savings and helping to educate her children. Her ambition is to open more restaurants.

loans.use: to buy a sack of beans, a half-sack of rice, a container of oil, and a plateful of salt.

loans.name: Aquati

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Aquati from Krootown central area in Freetown. She is married with one child aged 17 years. Her child is currently attending school. She began this business because she needed a permanent source of income to support her family. 

Aquati runs a bar and restaurant; she sells soft drinks, dry meat, chicken snacks, and fried rice. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business seven days per week. She also receives income from her husband. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate electricity supply.

Aquati has requested a loan in order to buy more assorted drinks, bags of rice, and a fan. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to have the biggest restaurant in town. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more assorted drinks, bags of rice, and a fan.

loans.name: Amly Group

texts.en:
This group is called AMLY. The group consists of four members: Altaf, Nabeela, Ymnat and Latifa. They know each other very well and live together in Sana'a, Yemen. All of them are working on embroidering ladies fabrics.  The group took a loan of 140,000 YER.

Altaf is 29 years old. She is the first woman on the right side who holds a fabric that is colored black and silver. She is a married woman and has six children. She has been working in embroidery for five years. She started her business as a hobby at her home where she embroidered at her leisure.  

She strives as much as possible to expand her business so that she can improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy embroidery materials such as needles, thread, and fabrics for her business.

In the future, she would like to expand her business. She wishes to open a big embroidery store and send her fabrics outside of Yemen because these types of products are required.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials such as needles, thread and fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Wendsongayamba Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALAMATA est la représentante du groupe WENDSONGAYAMBA. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre(04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 11 mois. Parmi ses enfants deux (02) vont à l’école. Elle a cinq (05) personnes en charge.

	Mme est vendeuse de pagnes et habits pour enfants depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de 10. Elle est ambulante.

	Mme veut s’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes et 15 habits pour enfant.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et aider son mari dans le foyer. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de vente en gros.
texts.en:
Ms. SALAMATA is the representative of the group WENDSONGAYAMBA. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is 11 months old. Two of the children go to school. She has five persons to support. 

Ms. SALAMATA has been a retailer of pagnes (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and children's clothing for fifteen years. She gets her supplies from Market 10. She is a street vendor. 

She wants to buy 10 lengths of 'pagne' cloth and 15 outfits for children. 

She uses her profits to bolster her business and to help out her husband at home. Her ambition is to open a wholesale store selling in bulk.

loans.use: to buy 10 lengths of 'pagne' cloth and 15 children's outfits

loans.name: Chhil

texts.en:
Chhil, 33, resides with her husband and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over three years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $15 per day. 

In order to improve her family's finances, Chhil is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase more groceries to resell. This purchase will enable her to make more profits to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor's degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: San José  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San José se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo atrás y formar este banco comunal, el cual les ha ayudado mucho ya que con el crédito que recibieron de la institución ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios, ellos se dedican a varias actividades como al comercio, artesanía y prestación de servicios.

En este lugar vive la señora Dorys,  tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas, edredones y almohadas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, trabaja tres  días a la semana,  sale a vender en los momentos que está desocupada y no tiene días fijos,  ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar sabanas, edredones y almohadas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos. 

Las tres fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The San José communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts which is renowned nationally and internationally. It is the hometown of the famous Panama hats. This is a group of people who decided to come together a while ago to establish this communal bank which has helped them a lot as, using the loans that they receive from the institution, they have been able to improve their small businesses. They work in a variety of fields such as sales, handicrafts and services. 

Dorys, who is 30 years old, lives in this place. She is in a common law marriage from which she has two children of 4 and 7 years old, the eldest studies at school, and the youngest in kindergarten. Her husband is a trader. Keen to earn something through her own means, and in that way help with the household expenses, she sells sheets, duvets and pillows. Her manner of selling is from door to door, and she also sells from her home where even her customers come. Dorys works three days a week and sells when she is not busy and does not work fixed days. She gives her customers loans and collects every fortnight. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to. Dorys has been working in this area for four years and it has been going very well. 

She will use this loan to buy sheets, duvets and pillows. She has been in the communal bank for eight loan cycles and she likes it because of the assistance that it gives her. Her dream is to give her children the best  

The three small photos are of three members who were unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy sheets, duvets and pillows.

loans.name: Habacuc Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADELEINE  AIDA est la représentante du groupe HABACUC. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre(04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 28 ans et le moins âgé a 12 ans. Parmi ses enfants deux (02) vont à l’école. Elle a cinq (05) personnes en charge.

	Mme est vendeuse de pagnes depuis 02 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont dans le quartier.

	Mme veut s’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Madeleine Aida is the representative of the HABACUC group. She is married and mother of four children. Her eldest child is 28 years old, and her youngest child is 12. Among her children, two of them go to school. She has five people living in her care.

She has been selling pagnes (colorful African wax cloth) for two years now. She stocks up at the market of the 10th sector of Ouagodougou. Her customers are from the neighborhood.

She wants to buy ten pagnes.

She uses her profits to strengthen her business. She is striving to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (colorful African wax cloth)

loans.name: Nomwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALIMATA est la représentante du groupe NOMWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq(05) enfants. Le plus âgé a 35 ans et le moins âgé a 24 ans. Parmi ses enfants un (01) va à l’école. Elle a sept (07) personnes en charge.

	Mme est vendeuse de bois depuis 02 ans. Elle s’approvisionne par chargement à domicile. Ses clients sont ses amis, voisins et autres.

	Mme veut s’acheter 02 chargements (02 camions) de bois.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour investir, épargner et contribuer à la scolarisation de son enfant. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. ALIMATA is the representative of the group NOMWENDE. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 24. One of the children goes to school. She has seven persons to support. 

Ms. ALIMATA has been a wood seller for two years. She gets her supplies by the truckload at her home. Her customers are her friends, neighbors, and others.

She wants to buy 2 loads (2 trucks) of wood. 

She puts her profits toward investing, saving money, and helping to educate her child. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 truckloads of wood

loans.name: Wendlateenda Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAMSSETOU est la représentante du groupe WENDLATEENDA II. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant de 27 ans. Elle a une (01) personne en charge.

	Mme est vendeuse d’articles féminins et de farine depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Sénégal pour les habits et boubous légers et au Burkina pour le maïs. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

	Mme veut s’acheter huit (08) sacs de maïs.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne voyager et importer ses produits en grande quantités.
texts.en:
Ms. HAMSSETOU is the representative of the group WENDLATEENDA II. She is married and the mother of a 27-year-old child. She has one person to support. 

Ms. HAMSSETOU has been selling women's items and flour for four years. She gets her supplies of clothing and light-weight boubous [long flowing outfits] from Senegal and of corn, from Burkina. Her customer base is composed of men and women. 

She wants to buy 8 sacks of corn. 

She puts her profits toward bolstering her business. Her ambition is to travel and import her goods in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of corn

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco, de 34 años de edad, es originario de Yali, Jinotega, el es campesino, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y café, es casado y padre de tres hijos. Inicio sus actividades de caficultor hace 6 años a la edad de 28 años , cuando compro 2 ½ manzanas de tierra aptas para la siembra de café , el dinero para la compra de terreno los obtuvo de una ganancia que obtuvo por la venta frijoles , después que termino esa cosecha fue que comenzó a invertir en la siembra de café. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo duro constante ha venido dándole mantenimiento a sus siembras de café, el vende su café en su comarca a compradores que  llegan en busca de café orgánico. Uno de sus mayores anhelos es llegar a participar en el concurso de tasa a la excelencia del café pues ahí es donde se puede dar a conocer a un mas su producción y lograr obtener una mejor ganancia para invertir más en ampliar las aéreas de café , el cual es un grano que requiere mucho capital de inversión . El requiere el préstamo para la compra de insumos de siembra y pago de mano de obra para la siembra de café. Pues el préstamo le ayudara a conseguir capital para comprar los insumos que le son muy necesarios para sacar buena producción. El tiene el proyecto de poder incrementar los niveles de producción de sus siembras de café.
texts.en:
Francisco is 34 years old and originally from Yali, Jinotega. He is a country dweller who grows vegetables and coffee. Francisco is married and the father of three children. He started his coffee-growing activities six years ago at the age of 28 when he purchased 2½ large plots of land for growing coffee. The money he used to pay for the land was earned from selling beans. After he finished that harvest, he began investing in the planting of coffee. With great effort and constant hard work, Francisco maintains his coffee plants. He sells the coffee in his area to buyers who are looking for organic coffee. One of his greatest wishes is to participate in a competition for coffee excellence. In order to do this, Francisco knows that he must produce more so that he can generate more earnings to invest in expanding his coffee fields. Achieving this result requires a great deal of investment capital.

Francisco is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for planting and to pay for labor required for planting coffee. The loan will help provide the capital for buying the supplies that are necessary for achieving good production. His intention is to increase his coffee production levels.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Bénoit

texts.fr:
Benoit est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Benoit travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de la rupture de stock.
Benoit a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Benoit voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Benoit is a 30-year-old man who is unmarried and without children. He has been working as a retailer since 2010. He sells grocery items to all comers to his store. He buys the goods in Lomé. He works by himself. At the moment, his main difficulty is an inventory shortage. 

Benoit requested his first loan from WAGES to buy some grocery items. He wants to reinvest in his business. 

In the next few years, Benoit would like to expand his business. With the profits, he says he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Kanda  Fodé Bayo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Takku Liggey Kanda" se compose de cinq femmes toutes mariées.Elles se cotisent chaque semaine pour s'appuyer mutuellement dans la constitution de caution leur permettant d'obtenir des prets à l'UIMCEC.Elles exercent dans le commerce de tissus, de produits cosmétiques, de chaussures et de sacs.Elles achètent en gros pour amoindrir les frais et se partagent les marchandises en fonction de l'apport de chacune. La vente de ces produits leur rapporte des revenus assez intéressants qui leur permettent  de subvenir à leurs besoins  et de soutenir leurs maris dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles.

Le chef du groupe, en médaillon, est mère de 3 enfants.Elle a ouvert une cantine devant son domicile et y expose des tissus de diverses qualités.Elle les vend soit au comptant ou à crédit. Elle paie avec ses bénéfices les frais de scolarité de ses deux filles. 

Pour renforcer leur fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus, des sacs et des chaussures.Elles ambitionnent de construire un grand magasin en centre ville.
texts.en:
The Takku Liggey Kanda group consists of five women who are all married. Every week, they contribute to a fund in order to raise the group guarantee, which allows them to obtain loans from the microfinance institution UIMCEC. They work as traders of textiles, cosmetics, shoes and bags. They buy wholesale in order to reduce costs and share out the goods according to the contribution of each member. The sale of these products earns them enough income to satisfy their needs and support their husbands in taking care of the maintenance costs of their families. 

The group leader, pictured on the left, has three children. She has opened a stand in front of her house, where she displays various qualities of fabrics. She sells them for cash or credit. With her profits, she pays the school fees for her two daughters. 

In order to strengthen their business capital, the group is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs so that they can buy textiles, bags and shoes. 

Their ambition is to open a department store in the city centre.

loans.use: to buy textiles, bags and shoes

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Gibrilla. He is married, and has 2 children aged 6 yrs and 3 yrs. In 2004, Gibrilla established his clothing business. He dropped out of school due to lack of financial support and so began doing small-scale trading to support himself. This business is now the main source of livelihood for his family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Gibrilla needs a loan in order to buy more clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Gibrilla plans to build a house and educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for his business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa est une femme âgée de 25 ans. Elle est célibataire et a un enfant de 20 mois.
Yawa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend des biscuits et des chaussures pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock car elle achète à crédit.
Yawa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des biscuits et des chaussures. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yawa voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de son enfant.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 25-year-old woman. She is unmarried and has a 20-month-old child. Yawa has been working as a retailer since 2006. She sells cookies and shoes to all comers at the market. She purchases the goods in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is an inventory shortage because she buys on credit. 

Yawa has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy cookies and shoes. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the next few years, she would like to expand her business. With this loan, she says she plans on taking care of her child.

loans.use: to buy cookies and shoes

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les femmes du groupe   Danaya   ont  en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Koutiala,  région de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités professionnelles. Elles font l’achat et la vente des  condiments, du savon des ustensiles de cuisine. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  3 eme prêt solidaire.
Madame, Mariam,  (arrêtée avec un enfant au bras  sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’ustensiles de cuisine de fabrication locale (à partir de l’aluminium par son mari). Mariam est très sollicitée et appréciée pour la qualité de ses matériels de cuisine proposés. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, toutes sortes d’ustensiles pour satisfaire sa cliente, auprès de son mari et effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All of the married in traditional extended families, the women of the group Danaya average 37 years of age and five children each, and they all live in Koutiala City, Region of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, and their professional work. They buy and sell condiments, soap, and kitchen utensils. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Ms. Maram (holding a child in her arms in the photo) is a major seller of kitchen utensils made locally (from aluminum by her husband). She is in high demand and much appreciated for the quality of the kitchen equipment she offers. 

Along with her husband, she intends to use her loan to buy all sorts of utensils to satisfy her customers. Accepting cash, she sells retail to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit 40,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in the business and used to meet certain household needs.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more  soft drinks

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames les 4 femmes du groupe  Faïda  ont  en moyenne 51 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Koutiala et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités professionnelles. 
Elles font l’achat et la vente du savon, de l arachide sous toutes ses formes. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 9 me  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les 8 précédents.
Madame,  Awa, deuxième de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, fait la transformation de l arachide en cacahouète et en pâte pour  la vente. 
Elle est très sollicitée et appréciée pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d arachide et des  chargements de bois pour le grillage au fur et à mesure, auprès des grossistes de la place et effectue ses ventes à la maison et au marché, au comptant et en détail, à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Awa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in polygamous families, the four women of the group Faïda average 51 years of age and five children each, and they all live in Koutiala City. They know one another through ties of community, kinship, and their professional work. They buy and sell soap and peanuts in all their forms. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their ninth solidarity loan after having properly repaid the previous eight loans. 

Ms. Awa (second from the right in the photo) processes peanut to obtain peanut butter to be sold. She is in high demand and much appreciated for the quality of the quality of her products. 

She intends to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of peanuts and some wood for roasting them, as needed. She purchases the peanuts from local wholesalers. Accepting cash, she sells retails at the house and at the market to a customer base composed of men and women.  

With this loan, Ms. Awa hopes to make an average monthly profit 95,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in the business and used to meet certain household needs.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Tigidankay

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Tigidankay. She has one dependent living with her. Tigidankay established her toy and lunch bowl business in 1992. She began her business because she needed a reliable source of income to support her family.

Working nine hours a day, seven days a week, Tigidankay earns about 1,500,000 SLL a month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL to buy six cartons of toys costing 3,500,000 SLL and lunch bowls at 1,000,000 SLL.

Tigidankay thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy toys and lunch bowls

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Catherine has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, detergent and beverages.

Catherine became a member of HSPFI in 2012.  In the future, Catherine hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants et deux vivent dans de familles traditionnelles élargies et deux dans de familles nucléaires, dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de miel et des fruits et des tubercules.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente AWA,  première personne à partir de la droite vers la gauche, compte acheté 3 paniers de papaye, 2 paniers de bananes douce, 2 alvéoles de pommes et 200 kilos de pomme de terre avec les revendeurs de la ville pour ensuite les vendre sur place dans la ville au bord du goudron en allant vers Ségou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’arachide.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djekafo are all married and average 48 years of age and five children. Two of the women live in traditional extended families, and two live in nuclear families in Fana City, in the Region of Koulikoro. The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in clothing, honey, fruit, and tubers. The group members are on their seventh solidarity loan. 

This client, Awa (first person from the right in the photo), intends to buy 3 baskets of papaya, 2 baskets of bananas, 2 trays of apples, and 200 kg of potatoes from the retailers in town. Then she will sell them locally in town on the road leading to Ségou. Her customer base is composed of women and men.
 
Awa envisions making an average monthly profit 75,000 francs CFA that will go toward family needs. Part of the profits is reinvested in the peanut business.

loans.use: to buy food provisions

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est constitué de 2 femmes mariées et 2 veuves ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à DOUGOUNINA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à travers  BATOMA, de la  vente de condiments et du jardinage.
BATOMA, qui a un bidon jaune devant elle sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  800 kilos  de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs des villages voisins. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA comprises two married women and two widows. The women average 40 years of age and six children each living in traditional families in DOUGOUNINA, a district in Bougouni City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their seventh collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers, and they trade in grains through Batoma, plus they sell condiments and vegetables. 

Batoma, who has a yellow container in front of her in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 800 kg of corn. She gets her supplies from peasant farmers in neighboring villages. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail at her house and at the market. Her customer base is composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit 30,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to support her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses, and the other part will be invested in the businesses.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de 5 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à TORAKABOUGOU, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leu première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de légumes avec  SARAN, de la  vente de savon, des condiments, des chaussures et des boucles d’oreilles.
SARAN, la seule  assise sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  2 chargements de charrette de légumes. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs des villages voisins. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group consists of five married women, averaging 43 years of age and 4 children each.  They live in traditional families in Torakabougou, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali).

It is the first time that these women are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers.  Saran sells vegetables, while the other members trade soap, condiments, shoes and earrings. 

Saran (the only woman sitting in the photo) is planning to buy two cartloads of vegetables with her loan.  She buys her goods from rural producers in nearby villages.  She sells from home to a customer base composed of men and women.  She is a retailer and sells for cash and on credit.  She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 25,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to support her husband with the daily expenses, while the rest will be invested into the business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali ont  en moyenne 49  ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de San dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de produits cosmétiques de bois de chauffe et diverses marchandises. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  4 eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Madame,   SADIO   (1ere debout à la droite sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de diverses marchandises. Elle est très sollicitée dans la ville de San. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de marchandises diverses (arachide pour faire les cacahouètes, des noix de coco, du gingembre pour le jus et quelques cartons de produits de beauté).Elle s’approvisionne tous les lundis à la foire de SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes en faisant la porte en porte des différentes structures professionnelles de la ville de SAN  et au marché, au  comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame SADIO  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 29.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and mostly in traditional extended families, the four women of the Sabali Group have an average age of 49 and 6 children. They all live in the city of San in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighborly, professional, and familial ties. They sell cosmetics, firewood, and various items.
In order to satisfy the demands of their customers, who are becoming more and more numerous and demanding, they have decided to turn to the loan group Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 4th solidarity loan with them, having paid their three previous loans in full.
Mrs. Sadio (1st standing on the left in the photo) is renowned for her sales of various items. She is highly sought after in San.
She hopes to use the loan to buy a large amount of various items (peanuts to make peanut butter, coconuts, ginger to make juice, and several boxes of beauty products.) She gets her supplies every Monday at the San fair. She makes her sales door-to-door at different businesses in San, and at the market, for cash, retail and credit to a diverse customer base.
With this loan, Mrs. Sadio plans on making a monthly profit of 29,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to help with her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy assorted items and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames les 7 femmes du groupe  Sabougnouman  ont  en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la préfecture de Koutiala et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités professionnelles. 
Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments, des friandises, d’habillements, du bois de chauffe, des médicaments  et de la viande. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe), après avoir correctement remboursés les 3 précédents.
Madame,  Mamou (première de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait la vente de viande cuite : soupe, brochettes. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, e chargements de bois  de chauffe pour la cuisson de la viande. Quant à la viande et ses ingrédients sont achetés tous les jours auprès des bouchers de la place. Elle  effectue ses ventes à la maison, au marché et de porte en porte, tous les soirs à partir de 16 heures, en détail, au comptant, à une clientèle mixte.  Madame Mamou est très sollicitée car sa soupe est de bon goût.    
Avec ce prêt, Madame Mamou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of the seven women of group Sabougnouman are married in polygamous families; they are in average 37 years old with three children. They all reside in Koutiala prefecture and got to know each other as neighbors, relatives, and professionals. They buy and sell condiments, snacks, clothing, firewood, medicine, and meat.
To increase their working capital, the group's members joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan), having repaid the previous three in a timely manner.
Mrs. Mamou, to the left in the photo, sells cooked meat skewers and soups. She is planning on using her loan to purchase bundles of firewood to cook meat. As for meat and other ingredients, she purchases them daily from local butchers. She retails from her home, at the market, and door-to-door; she serves daily from 4pm and takes cash and credit. Her clientele is mixed. Mrs. Mamou is very much in demand because her soup is delicious.
With this loan, Mrs. Mamou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to cover some household expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food service.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de femmes mariées et ayant en moyenne  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à TORAKABOUGOU, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments avec  AMI, de la  vente des articles de tablettes
et des chaussures.
AMI, avec un sac d’oignon  en main sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  600Kg d’oignons. Elle s’approvisionne a Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile et au marche à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is comprised of married women who average 38 years of age and four children each living in traditional families in TORAKABOUGOU, a district in Bougouni City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their first collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. The group members do commerce in condiments with Ami, and they sell shelf items and shoes. 

Ami (holding a sack of onions in the photo) intends to use her loan to buy 600 kg of onions. She gets her supplies in Sikasso. Accepting cash or credit, she sells retail to a customer base composed of men and women at her home and at the market. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit 35,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to support her husband in covering day-to-day expenses, and the other part will be invested in the business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Sekouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sekouba est marié et âgé de trente deux ans. Il est père de deux enfants et vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme et ses enfants à Ouelessebougou. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans réussite, il opta finalement pour l’achat vente des habillements. Il est très sollicité et apprécié à Ouelessebougou et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui,  il est à son premier prêt individuel .
Il compte acheter, 2 balles de tissus et 1 dizaine de chemises à Bamako auprès des grossistes qu’il revendra au marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les villages environnants, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000  F CFA par mois, qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Mr. Sekouba is married and is thirty-two years old. He is the father of two children and lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in Ouelessebougou.

After conducting many unsuccessful activities, he finally opted for the purchase and sales of clothing. He is much in demand and appreciated throughout Ouelessebougou and the surrounding area.

To satisfy an increasing number of demanding customers he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This is his first individual loan.

He intends to buy two bales of cloth and a dozen shirts from wholesalers in Bamako. He will then resell them at the Ouelessebougou market and in surrounding villages, to both men and women customers.

He expects to make a profit of 40,000 FCFA francs per month, which will be used for family expenses, and the remainder will be reinvested in his business activity..

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Sewesse Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les  femmes du groupe Sewesse ont  en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de SAN dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de  condiments alimentaires et le commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er   prêt solidaire.
Madame, Valentine (2ème femme debout de la  droite  vers la gauche sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de tissus. Elle est très sollicitée dans son quartier.
